description.narrative: The overall objective of the project is to empower municipal councils become more effective & autonomous bodies, better able to withstand the executive’s influence, by properly fulfilling their assigned roles of legislation, oversight and representation.

activity-description.narrative: Selected municipality for support during the first year

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output indicator
1. The value of PEFA index on orderliness and participation of the municipal councils in the annual budget process increased 2. Annual increase of the Basic Budget of the participating municipalities 3. The value of PEFA index on public access to key fiscal information increased 4. The score of the councilors’ and citizens’ satisfaction with participation in the budgeting process 5. Municipal councils’ role in the local power triangle with Mayors and municipal administration reinforced thanks to increased knowledge and confidence on the part of councilors 6. The value of PEFA index on budget implementation (aggregate expenditure out-turn compared to original approved budget) increased. 7. The value of PEFA index on effectiveness in collection of tax payments increased. 8. The value of PEFA index on effectiveness of internal audit increased 9. The score on citizen satisfaction with the transparency and accountability of the municipal bodies increased. 10. Number of municipal councils that demonstrate capacity for adequate gender budgeting
Activity indicators
1.1 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of key budget documents and reports 1.2 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of the external audit recommendations 1.3 Percentage of municipalities that regularly publish financial information on the municipal web-sites: - Current Year Budget - Annual Report 1.4 Number of municipal councils that regularly discuss in-year financial reports 1.5 Percentage of the municipalities that regularly publish on-line information on: - Municipal Council Session Agenda - Municipal Council Session Minutes - Contact details of the councillors 1.6 Percentage of the municipalities that offer problem reporting on-line tools 1.7 Number of prepared and adequately budgeted annual Action Plans for equal opportunities of women and men 1.8 Number of activities proposed by councillors for nurturing and fostering inter-communit

1.1. Number of certified councilors through e-Knowledge platform that demonstrate understanding of key budget documents and reports N=50 1.3 Percentage of municipalities that regularly publish financial information on the municipal web-sites N= 81 (75%) 1.5 Percentage of the municipalities that regularly publish on-line information on: - Municipal Council Session Agenda N=81 (50%) - Municipal Council Session Minutes/ conclusions N= 81(50%) - Contact details of the councilors N=81 (50%) 1.6 Percentage of municipalities that offer problem reporting on-line tools N=81(50%) 1.7 Number of prepared and adequately budgeted Annual Action Plans for equal opportunities of women and men N=24 1.9 Number of innovative measures adopted by the beneficiary municipalities (at least one measure per municipality) N=24 2.1 The number of municipalities that organize community and/or budget forums at least twice per year N= 24 2.5 Number of priority community projects that are implemented by the participating municipalities, creating broader positive societal impact with emphasis on social inclusion and addressing vulnerabilities N= 30 3.1 Number of networking events that enable improved horizontal communication and cooperation among council members from different municipalities: - thematic networking through events; N=7 - cross-border cooperation with peers across the region N=1 3.2 Number of: - joint positions on common needs and interests formulated and promoted; N=40 - initiatives for legislative and practical changes needed for municipal councils to function more effectively; N=2 3.3 Overall proportion of councilors that are using developed mutually reinforcing info-exchange, cooperation and peer to peer learning system (e-Knowledge platform) N=1300
Cross-cutting Annual (2020) and Semi-annual (2021) Analytical reports on the municipal revenues and expenditures (Reports on Fiscal Decentralization) Second PEFA assessment in preselected municipalities N=6 Website assessment of all 81 ULSG N=81 Qualitative and quantitative Governance Assessment N=24 Promotional videos on Priority project’s implementation Final evaluation report

1.1. 22 councilors have been certified using the interactive courses available on the e-Knowledge platform designed in the frames of the EMC project
1.2. 79% of municipalities publish financial details on the Annual municipal Budget for the current year on their municipal websites 1.5. 54% of municipalities timely publish the agenda of the council sessions. 70% of municipalities publish minutes/conclusions from the council sessions. 89% of municipalities publish contact details of the councilors
1.6. 67% of municipalities offer online problem reporting tools to its citizens
1.7. 22 municipalities have prepared action plans and allocated funds for implementation of activities. Municipality of Kumanovo and Tetovo didn’t establish a functional Committee for Equal Opportunities but made efforts to incorporate gender responsive activities in the existing budget lines and programmes. Most of the partner municipalities over the implementation of the project have increased the funds dedicated for this purpose.
1.9. 24 partner municipalities have adopted innovative measure to increase transparency and accountability of local governance bodies, through livestream od council sessions (18 municipalities), applications for citizens participation on budget priorities in municipality of Centar, upgrade of municipal websites in Gjorce Petrov, Kumanovo, and Struga enabling citizens to directly communication with local governance bodies, e-kiosks in Tetovo and Gostvar, enabling citizens to receive license and documents without interacting with civil servants which increases the quality of services and decreases the possibility of corruption.
Innovative measures promoted by the project were selected as OGP most efficient measure for increasing the local democracy. The projects’ measures were voted as the best one in the country and awarded with the third place in Europe.
MoF and MLSG lobbied and requested from all municipalities to install and use the application developed by the project, showing quarterly financial municipal reports more visible and easier to understand by citizens.
2.1. 24 partner municipalities have conducted 126 forum sessions during the project implementation giving the opportunity to citizens to decide their priorities and influence the decision making in local level.
2.5. 33 priority community projects have been implemented in 24 partner municipalities having as main focus the social inclusion of different marginalized groups.
3.1. 6 workshops for thematic working group members were conducted to enrich councilors with the knowledge related to various areas of local governance such as gender equality, inter-ethnic relations, urbanization and spatial planning, education. 5 women councilors attended the second Forum of Women Mayors of SEE. 3.2. 59 recommendations addressed by councilors regarding their common needs are recorded during the TWG workshops and meetings. 3.3. Over 1300 councilors have active profiles and access to e-Knowledge platform. By the end of 2021 more than 8000 visits/number of logins registered on thee-Knowledge platform. Cross-cutting Finalized Annual (2020) and Semi-annual (2021) Analytical reports on the municipal revenues and expenditures (Reports on Fiscal Decentralization); Finalized Cumulative Analytical report on the municipal revenues and expenditures (Comparative Report on Fiscal Decentralization) for the period 2013-2020; Second PEFA assessment conducted in 6 selected municipalities (Chair, Veles, Sveti Nikole, Strumica, Valandovo, Ohrid); Website assessment of all 81 LSGUs conducted; Qualitative and Quantitative Government Assessment Conducted with councilors of all 24 partner municipalities.

1.1 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of key budget documents and reports N=15 1.2 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of the external audit recommendations N=15 1.3 Percentage of municipalities that regularly publish financial information on the municipal web-sites N= 15 (100%) 1.5 Percentage of the municipalities that regularly publish on-line information on: - Municipal Council Session Agenda N=12 (80%) - Municipal Council Session Minutes N=5 (33%) - Contact details of the councilors N=15 (100%) 1.6 Percentage of municipalities that offer problem reporting on-line tools N=12 (80%) 1.7 Number of prepared and adequately budgeted Annual Action Plans for equal opportunities of women and men N=8 1.9 Number of innovative measures adopted by the beneficiary municipalities (at least one measure per municipality) N=15 2.1 Number of municipalities that organize community and/or budget forums at least twice per year N=15 2.5 Number of priority community projects that are implemented by the participating municipalities, creating broader positive societal impact with emphasis on social inclusion and addressing vulnerabilities N=9 3.1 Number of networking events that enable improved horizontal communication and cooperation among council members from different municipalities: - thematic networking through events; N=4 - virtual peer groups organized through the e-learning platform; N=7 - cross-border cooperation with peers across the region; N=2 3.2 Number of: - joint positions on common needs and interests formulated and promoted, N=8 - initiatives for legislative and practical changes needed for municipal councils to function more effectively, N=1 3.3 Overall proportion of councilors that are using developed mutually reinforcing info-exchange, cooperation and peer to peer learning system (e-Knowledge platform) N=175 3.4 Number of international cooperation of the municipal councils and exchange of experiences realized N=2
Cross-cutting

1.1 Capacity development trainings on 11 Modules were organized for municipal councils in 15 municipalities. The topics of the trainings and handbooks contained topics such as the role of municipal councilors in the local governance, budgeting, financial revenues and expenditures, financial audits, urban and special planning, inter-municipal collaboration or transversal topics such as equal opportunities for man and women, inter-ethnic relations. 24 trainings were delivered for 150 municipal councilors from 9 municipalities one third of whom are women. 1.2 Capacity development Programme involved a training module involved contents on the internal control, internal audit and external audit of municipal revenues and public enterprises under the municipality. 1.3 All municipalities involved in the project publish regularly the quarterly financial reports on the municipal revenues and expenditures. 1.5 All 15 municipalities involved in the project regularly publish contact details of the municipal councilor, members of the council committees, agenda of the forthcoming council sessions and minutes from the council session. The decisions of the municipal council regularly are published also on the municipal bulleting. 1.6 Municipalities have developed online reporting tools where citizens can address issues regarding to the work of the municipality. This ensures transparency of the work of the municipality. 1.7 8 out of 15 municipalities have a prepared Action Plan for equal opportunities for man and woman and budget allocated to implement the foreseen activities.
1.9 All 15 municipalities have prepared project proposal for supply for equipment which will be used for life-streaming of council meetings as an innovative measure for transparency and accountability of the municipal councils and /or development of online platforms for citizen’s communication. 2.1. Project partner municipalities have organized and conducted 36 sessions of the community forums for priority community projects. 2.5 In 2019 totally 57 project concepts were prepared and presented by different interested parties during the conducted community forums. Based on the previously presented criteria for selection with main focus on social inclusion of vulnerable and marginalized groups 9 project have been selected as priority community projects by the same working groups through democratic voting process. The whole decision-making process was led and conducted by representatives of the communities in the 9 municipalities. In addition to these, two more forums were organized in 2 municipalities for modification of the selected priority projects. 3.1. Several networking events were organized to enable horizontal networking and cooperation between the councilors such as: Annual workshop with all Presidents of the municipal councils, workshop of the Thematic working groups on Finance and Budgeting, Local Economic Development and Equal opportunities for man and women. In addition, forums groups for all seven thematic groups that have been created on the e- Knowledge platform are functioning and councilors to discuss different topics, give suggestions, share knowledge and experiences. 3.2 On the request of the Committee of Councils, ZELS has required from all municipalities based on the structure of the municipality itself to develop a unit, sector or appoint a person for support to municipal council. Aiming to empower the role of the Committee of the council, members of it organized regional workshops with presidents of the councils from each region to discuss the role of the Committee and challenges the councilors face while they’re performing their legally binding duties and responsibilities,N=2 3.3. Over 175 councilors have access to the e-knowledge platform where they can follow the new knowledge’s, information contained in the project activities as well as communicate with their peers around the country. 3.4. Five women councilors had a chance to be exposed to regional practices and meet with their peers in Istanbul, Republic of Turkey on the Marmara Forum on Cities Developing Solutions and in Sombor, Republic of Serbia on The Forum of Women Mayors and Council Presidents of South East European countries on Gender Responsive Budgeting, N=2
Cross – cutting
Annual (2018) and Semi-annual (2019) Analytical reports on the municipal revenues and expenditures (Reports on Fiscal Decentralization) and Assessment Report of the prescribed forms of K-1 and K-2 quarterly reports. Promotional video for the project activities and its results prepared and published for broader audience
